intro: Crataegus parvifolia var. florida, commonly known as the Florida hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by red berries in the fall. The plant has simple, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a generally compact growth habit. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
